alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 16 at 10:24PM EDT until April 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT/4 AM CDT/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper Michigan and western Upper Michigan, including the following areas, in central Upper Michigan, Baraga, Dickinson, Iron and Marquette. In western Upper Michigan, Gogebic, Keweenaw, Northern Houghton, Ontonagon and Southern Houghton. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EDT/4 AM CDT/ Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
